subject: Re: [junit] writing MultiThreaded test cases using Junit

messageBody:
schennamaraja wrote:

> Hi!
> I need to write a test case where I need to spun off different
> threads to test one of my classes to test the thread safety of that
> class. I was wondering how do I do that using junit.
>

You could write a test for the class that asserts expected results in a
single-threaded mode, then wrap it in a JUnitPerf LoadTest to verify that the
test continues to pass in a multi-threaded environment.

int maxUsers = 10;
Test loadTest = new LoadTest(YourTestCase.suite(), maxUsers);

JUnitPerf is freely available at
http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

Mike
